title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' starring Jennifer Lopez is streaming on Hulu, based on the Tony Award-winning musical.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run,' a Beatles documentary by Morgan Neville, is available on Prime Video.
'Bridgerton' Season 4 focuses on Benedict's story and is streaming on Netflix, continuing the popular series.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided during a Red Sox spring training game but remained in the game.
The collision, resulting from miscommunication, saw Anthony receive a bruise and Rafaela a hamstring hit.
Both players continued playing and contributed hits in the game, including Rafaela's two-run home run.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to Jimmy Fund when a Red Sox player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
Cora's donation will be his largest to the Boston-based organization linked to the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute.
In previous years, Cora donated based on team performance, including $10,407.96 in 2021 for Red Sox wins.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The N.H. House passed the CHARLIE Act banning critical race theory and LGBTQ+ discussions in schools, with a 184-164 vote.
Named after activist Charlie Kirk, the bill mandates a "neutral or patriotic" education, limiting certain academic frameworks.
Violating educators could face disciplinary actions or credential revocation; the act now moves to the Senate Education Committee.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in North Adams are created using food coloring, a decades-old local tradition.
Social media users share nostalgia and inquiries about the icicles, with some recalling childhood experiences.
The Hairpin Turn, constructed in 1914, offers scenic views and features nearby attractions like The Golden Eagle Restaurant.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirmed its first two measles cases of 2026, involving a school-aged child and an adult in Greater Boston.
The Boston-area adult with an unknown vaccination history visited multiple locations while infectious, potentially exposing others, officials report.
Nationally, the U.S. is experiencing a measles outbreak with 1,136 confirmed cases in 2026, despite high vaccination rates in Massachusetts.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, a 33-year-old South Boston resident, passed away on February 21, 2026, after a brief illness.
She was known in her community for appearing in a Dunkin' Donuts commercial and working for Boston Inspectional Services.
Mallard-Vitiello is survived by her husband Francis, children Mya and Frankie, and various family members and friends.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton will run the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor her late father who died from ALS.
Hamilton aims to raise awareness and funds for The ALS Association through her participation in the marathon.
Her father, a former Boston salesman, deeply loved the city, inspiring her to run the Boston Marathon.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion to the Supreme Judicial Court regarding an audit lawsuit against legislative leaders.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell seeks to dismiss DiZoglio's lawsuit, arguing the state auditor lacks authority without her office's approval.
DiZoglio claims Campbell's conflict of interest necessitates appointing a special assistant attorney general to defend her audit efforts.

title: This speech-language therapist is running Boston to fund autism support services
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Carrie Kerstein, a speech-language therapist from Cambridge, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support autism services.
Kerstein is fundraising for the Doug Flutie Jr. Foundation for Autism, linking her running passion to her professional work.
The Flutie Foundation provides funding for vital autism support services, including speech-language therapy, to empower autistic individuals and families.
